titleStmt.title: The Longer Now of Ulysses: Digital Life After Analog Death
"wanderingRocks"

publicationStmt.publisher: "The Longer Now of Ulysses: Digital Life After Analog Death" published by David Carlton as part of the "Long Now of Ulysses" library exhibit, hosted, sponsored and produced by the University of Victoria, English 507 and English 520.

p.l: from her light skirt a clinging twig.

lb.l: Father Conmee blessed both gravely and turned a thin page of his

p.l: breviary. Sin : Principes persecuti sunt me gratis : et a verbis tuis formidavit cor

lb.l: Corny Kelleher closed his long daybook and glanced with his drooping

p.l: eye at a pine coffinlid sentried in a corner. He pulled himself erect, went to it
and, spinning it on its axle, viewed its shape and brass furnishings. Chewing
his blade of hay he laid the coffinlid by and came to the doorway. There he
tilted his harbrim to give shade to his yes and leaned against the doorcase,

lb.l: Father John Conmee stepped into the Dollymount tram on Newcomen
Corning Kelleher locked his largefooted boots and gazed, his hat downtilted,
Constable 57 C, on his beat, stood to pass the time of day.
— That's a fine day, Mr Kelleher.
— It's very close, the constable said.
